pedpedI assume that my questions stay since it has not been answered so I'm posting it again here:
Q1:When does an alien steak expires? If someone hid the alien steak and one other guy search for it then he found nothing would it be safe to assume that the hidden alien steak has disappeared/expired already?

They disappear at the end of cycle 8 on the day you bring them back from the planet. (Except if you freeze them or if food destruction is turned off.)

[5426779]

Q3: Can i somewhat change skill set ? I have 3 lvl Janice with Shrine, IT expert, Neron best friend. When i start new game, i already have the same skills, and cant select others.
On november 21, 2013
[68111]
RebelzQ3: Can i somewhat change skill set ? I have 3 lvl Janice with Shrine, IT expert, Neron best friend. When i start new game, i already have the same skills, and cant select others.

Whenever you wake up and have more slots available than the skills you have unlocked for the character, the game assigns automatically skills to the character.

This means that in order to choose which skills you want as a gold player, you need to have the character above level 5, when you join a new ship.

Q21
Who can drive the ship? What happens when all the ship-drivers are inactive?
On november 22, 2013
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A 21
Only the commander (normally Jin Su) can move the ship. If he is dead or inactive, the title is given to his successor (see the list here). When the commander is away or not active enough but still has the title, someone can take the hacker kit to access the command terminal and move the ship.

Zack

Q24: can a Mush change his skills during the tripp?
It appears that on the second ship already there was a Mush getting invisible when he infectet someone else successfully.
On november 22, 2013
Meadow

A24: No you can't 'change' your skills. However, you can 'save' your skill slots and select a skill at another time as Mush/Human. For example, if I would have 5 skills as Chao I could select 4 of them any time I wanted, selecting 3 first and the 4th situational.

As Mush, you can just select 1 skill, and 3 later situational. This is assuming ofcourse if said person has Gold Mode.

Q30 In the finished games honors page, there's a little person next to a heart, and if you hover over it, it reads "[Name] was appreciated by [x] players for their qualities during this voyage." How do you give appreciation to someone?
On november 23, 2013
[6826491]

A30: On the screen in which you write your last words and confirm your death (or your return) you can note which players you appreciated. Just make sure to do so before you confirm your last words, or the option will be gone for good. Even the Mush players will get them, if they played the game well. I prefer to play for likes than for glory, personally. That to me is a better measure of how much I contributed to the crew.

On november 23, 2013
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?
TalynQ 29 I'm organizing a group of other newer players into an expedition and was concerned about the mush still on board. I'm told if the ship moves, anyone out in the Pasiphae, Icarus or Patrol ships dies. If we're on the expedition, does all it take it someone to move the ship out of orbit (which takes a cycle before doing another move) or do you also have to move them ship again afterwards? Also, how does Magnetic Return work in this scenario? If a player moves the ship while the Icarus is on an expediton, does it pull the crew back?

All members of the team will die as soon as the Daedalus leaves the orbit. The magnetic return works in that situation, so the Icarus will return to the ship if it moves. The other solution is to make sure someone you trust (generally Chun) keeps the hacker kit safe. And hope that the commander isn't Mush, if he doesn't come to the planet.


LolitaTheLoliWhy is it so hard to survive on a ship even after all the mush are dead.
Also what are all the ways to get scrap metal in a game and how would you go about repairing the ship.

Because it would be boring if it was too easy. There would be nothing to do after the Mush are dead. (It doesn't become more difficult because the Mush are dead, by the way. It becomes more and more difficult as time goes by.)

You can collect scrap metal with the Pasiphae ship in alpha bay 2, or by dismantling objects. To repair the ship, you must take a scrap metal, the oscilloscope if you have it on your ship, and the wrench, which makes it easier

Please put a number before your questions.


NasusIf an earlier commander drops his title after giving a mission, will the new commander be able to give mission?

Yes.


CalibQ 32
This is the second time in a row I have noticed Gioele has not had a walkie talkie. Does he not start with a walkie talkie or am I just unlucky?

It's not specific about Gioele. When beginners do the tutorial, they don't have a walkie talkie when they wake up. The last part of the tutorial make them go to the bridge, search the room and find their walkie talkie, then say hi. If they don't finish it, they can't talk.

[6259878]

Showers are always personal, and never visible to other people.
*Q33a* even if there is a camera?
On november 23, 2013
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

No, not even if there is a camera. A personal action (written in purple italics) is never revealed by cameras or by the presence of other people. What can be revealed by a camera is a secret or furtive action (written in a blue frame with a icon, and if it has been revealed, in a red frame).

Chao and Chun can see showers by using torture or premonition, though.

RiceBeer

Q39: It says here in the Robo Fido description: Try to repair equipment before you leave.

Does that mean I have to stay in the same room with Robo Fido until it fixes the equipment?

A39. Nope drones spend there action during cycle change. So lets say you drop drone at broken Fuel tank during cycle 5, cycle 6 tank should be fixed. If there are 2 things broken (like in engine room) or equipment and door drone will fix one of them and remain in that room, then next cycle fix something else. If drone is upgraded to turbo it can fix 2 items per cycle change, Also check this thread Drones 101

On november 24, 2013
[6826491]

A45: It's due to the movement that Terrence has available to him. Someone in the room with him can push him out of the room, and he moves out for 0 MP. That is the message you quoted. There are many benefits to this, including free movement to say, repeatedly and efficiently move plants from one area to another, or to move to repair something on the other end of the ship, and all for minimal MP. As long as the other crew members are positioned in the correct rooms, he can move any non-heavy equipment to wherever it's needed. Fun stuff, in my experience; it makes teamwork with him highly beneficial.

On the other hand, the downside: if he is moving without the help of anyone, he uses 1 MP just like anyone else would. But...if he runs out of MP, he uses 1 AP per room moved, if nobody is able to help him. With a Scooter, or the Sprinter skill, he gets what amounts to "normal" movement for everyone else, PLUS he gets his free movement. This is why a lot of smart Terrence players ask to use the Scooter.

Q52 How do you get the forum title?
On november 25, 2013
Rain
CalibQ48 (expanded)
I mean moer along the lines of "what does Technician allow you to do".

You get a free tech point each day to use on attempting to repair or dismantle something. You start with 2, which is the max you can hold, when you use the book. You also have higher base chances on repairing and dismantling things than non techs. The higher chance does not apply to reinforcing the ship's hull, however.

CalibQ49
Our Janice is dead and I have caught a mental disorder (Agoraphobia). Can Chun heal me in the med bay?

I don't think so. As far as I know, mental illnesses can only be cured by lying in the same room as a shrink, taking drugs which specifically cure them, or in rare instances, getting lucking with finding good alien fruit which cure them. Some illnesses go away on their own over time, not sure which ones though.

AstrosQ50
Total newbie question, can you see if people are mush by hitting them? (One guy punched me on my ship and told me he was checking if I was a mush).

Not directly, no. A Chao with torture skill might do this because then his torture reveals more actions, but that's about the only scenario I can think of for punching someone to help figure it out.


OranjQ52 How do you get the forum title?

Do you mean any title or a specific one? Really vague question. If you want to set a title, go to your nexus, click your name, and find change community title.

Q70 Is there a way to improve the aiming to hit hunters more often or is it random how many hunters you hit? It really sucks when you fire four times and you hit nothing.
On november 26, 2013
[6826491]
LawMcquireQ70 Is there a way to improve the aiming to hit hunters more often or is it random how many hunters you hit? It really sucks when you fire four times and you hit nothing.

A70: You can click on the specific target you wish to hit, which is good for picking off an already damaged ship. Otherwise, you always change targets randomly after every successful hit.

There is a "hidden" research available, that can help with accuracy: NCC Lenses - to research it, you must have the cat in your inventory as you access the Lab. Just having the cat in the room is not sufficient. The two Lenses created will increase accuracy by 10% each when worn: 88% accuracy for one, and a staggering 96% if both are worn.

Beyond that, there is a rare Vending Machine item (also bought with Klix, and only applies to the current voyage) that increases accuracy by 15%, and it increases Pilots' accuracy to 99% in a patrol ship. Last time I was on a ship that had it, I still counted at least two misses by our five pilots.

Q71:
How to avoid mycoalarm? How to find mycoalarm and destroy it? Does mycoalarm ring only during spiking/infecting or extracting too? I'm playing as Paola and I'm mush agent..they just finished mycoalarms....
On november 26, 2013
[7896759]

Q72: Can you become dirty from picking up a drone?
On november 26, 2013
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A 70
There's also a helmet that can be built with a blueprint, it has about the same effect as the lenses.

A 71
Mycoalarms only ring when you spike someone. They never ring for anything else, not even for spore extraction. You can find hidden mycoalarms by searching rooms, but you will immediately be suspected if you do that.

One solution is to find out who has hidden the alarms (usually it's Chun, sometimes Finola when she finishes the research, or Eleesha because part of her job is to search rooms, so she needs to know where the alarms are, to avoid discovering them by mistakes). If you know who it was, you can try to look where they went. It's easier with Chun, because she normally stays in the lab and medlab, so if you see that she was in the nexus or the engine room, you can suppose she went there to hide a mycoalarm. It's much more difficult if it's Eleesha, because she can go anywhere.

A 72
No, you can't.

Q80: How long do expeditions take? Do they vary and is there any way to tell before you set out? Thanks!
On november 27, 2013
Adoncia

A80: Most expeditions will take 90 minutes.
Exceptions are:
If someone with Sprinter skill comes along, the expedition will visit one extra zone, thus taking 10 minutes longer.
If the planet is smaller than 9 zones, you will run out of places to explore and return earlier (each zone takes 10 minutes to explore, and you only go to each once).
Some zones have the possibility to send you back to the ship early (Seismic and Mankarog, maybe there are more).

Q105: If the tabulatrix secret list only lists 1 or more mush, what use is it? If it only lists 1 possible mush, then everyone off the list could also be the second mush. Does it only list 1 mush if there's only 1 mush left?
On november 27, 2013
[1757645]

A105: If you have a list of 4 people, let's say. One of those has been acting really suspicious, and the other three are really helpful, then chances are that he's a MUSH and you should kill them. True, others on or off the list can still be MUSH, but at least you have a lead on one of them.

Also, if you manage to kill a MUSH early enough, then the list allows you to know who isn't a MUSH. (By not being on the list.) At least for a little while. It's another clue to a MUSH identity. It's not conclusive, but it gives you some people to examine.

BobGoldQ94: Can the neron announcement "Connection with Sol interrupted. Cause : unknown." be a sabotage?

No. The connection can be interrupted by Xyloph DB, when the communications terminal is broken, when someone cooks with the micro-wave, and also at random.

Yes.


SaboteurQ96: How many Hull Points does 1scrap metal restore? With and without using Osciloscope.

10 with the oscilloscope, 5 without it.


AlyarinQ 104: Does the Mutate ability heal HP?

Yes, but it's irreversible.


TnxxCan Mush get sick from the insects event during an expedition?

Yes and no. They can be attacked by an insect, and they will have a message in their personal log saying that they have caught an illness. But actually they won't be ill at all, they won't have the illness status and will have no symptoms.


SaboteurQ106: I have been hurt: Torn tongue. What can I do?

You can go to the medlab, lie on the bed, then use the surgery pod to heal yourself. Or, if Finola is a medic and you manage to find the post-its, write a message and ask her to conduct surgery on you.

Q122 - How we can collect scraps with pilot skills?

[6288065]

Q123. Is BBBRRRRIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIINNNNNGGGGG in log from MycoAlarm?
On november 29, 2013
[1765606]

A121 - The hacker kit can be used to gain access to either the Command Terminal (which lets you move the ship) or the BIOS Terminal (which lets you change some settings, like what's locked and what's unlocked on the ship). Using it requires ap, though, and there's a fairly low chance of success.

A122 - To collect scrap, go out in the Pasiphae (the funny looking ship in Alpha Bay 2). You can collect scrap using 2 ap, though you can only collect scrap once someone has destroyed hunters and if you move the ship, you'll lose all the potential scrap in space.

[68111]
shammashQ124 - Right now i am playing as terrence which skill i should chose technician or robotics expert? Can i dismantle object without repair skill, and what does a drone and robotics expert do actually?

Ask which skill the people on your ship would want you to take.

a) Technician will increase your chances to repair things and give you 1 repair point every day. Gives the ability to dismantle things.
b) Robotics expert will give you a blueprint for a 2nd drone and you will be able to upgrade drones. These things need scrap metal.

A159 A and 159 D:


D: You can't place spores

On november 30, 2013
[1822782]

A158: http://twd.io/e/mT7M0g

Enfilade
  • Mutate (3AP): The ever-popular "transform into a repulsive killbeast" trick, this irreversible action sacrifices your cover and makes you a huge target. On the plus side, you will immediately heal a bit, and your hits will do some extra damage (probably +1-2); plus, you get a permanent guarding stance, which means humans must either stay and fight you or they must leave the room. The downsides? You lose all spores stored on you and can no longer extract; you drop all items in your inventory and cannot pick anything up again; you lose access to all of your skills; and you remove all doubt as to your identity. This should generally be a last resort, as humans will not hestitate to attack and kill you afterward. Although, it could make a great distraction under the right circumstances...Furthermore, your physiology makes you immune to hunger and morale loss (this means you need to eat and seek morale boosting regularly to appear human). You can see the properties of fruits and drugs regardless of your human skills. However, you have a strong reaction to water: showering causes you damage.

Q 177 If there is a fire in one of Rear Storages where fuel tank resides, will it explode in a while? Will there be any penalties if fire continues to burn? What are the effects of broken fuel tank except that you can't take fuel out of it?
On december 2, 2013
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A 177
Fuel tanks don't explode, and they don't leak like oxygen tanks. The only effect when they're broken is that you can't take fuel out of them.

Fire can do damage to the hull of the Daedalus, break equipment in the room, destroy objects, injure people and spread to other rooms. All this can happen as soon as the fire starts, and if you don't extinguish it, next cycle it can do more damage (break equipment that wasn't broken yet, spread to yet more rooms, destroy more objects...).

[7918000]

*Q191* When the logs show someone cuddling the cat twice, it means one was a mush infecting it right?
On december 3, 2013
Adoncia

A190: Coffee is basically just another kind of food. You get one per day from the machine (more with completed PILGRED). It normally gives 2AP, but if Gioele has the Caffeine Junkie skill, he will get 4AP instead.
So if you are drinking coffee, you won't need food. But the rest of your crew will! There isn't enough coffee for everyone to share.
On december 3, 2013
TradeFederation
StartopiaQ190 I've noticed that drinking coffee can cure starvation. So what's the point of food? Can't we just survive indefinitely off coffee? (And can someone explain exactly how coffee normally works? I've never used it. And how it's different for Gioele) Thanks!

A 190 : Food has different (better) effects than coffee, as does fruit and steaks, and they are all more filling. Coffee is a limited resource, only one cup per day ship wide, until you finish the Pilgred or have a certain skill. Coffee can be immediately combined with food for more AP, but you cannot eat 2 foods back to back, so mixing food and coffee is better than just food.

TradeFederation
Genyaarikado*Q191* When the logs show someone cuddling the cat twice, it means one was a mush infecting it right?

A 191. No, it means they are a n00b. Cuddling the cat only helps certain crewmembers gain morale one time, or a mush infect the cat, but either act only works once. Anyone can cuddle the cat more than once, but there is no benefit, for Mush or human in doing it, just another chance that the cat scratches you and hurts/spores you.

Q207: Can the current commander of the ship go on an expedition to a planet?
On december 4, 2013
NotaBene

A205: No it doesn't.

Consumption is :
- 1 Oxygen per cycle with no damage on O2 reservoir.
- 2 Per cycle with one damaged reservoir
- 3 per cycle with 2 damaged reservoir.

At midnight, each adult plant (if treated correctly) will produce 1 oxygen directly added to the reservoir.
On december 4, 2013
TradeFederation
TommyQ207: Can the current commander of the ship go on an expedition to a planet?

A 207: Yes, and you usually WANT the commander to go. Unlike Star Trek, there is no second in command on the Daedalus, so by having the captain on the ground, they ship actually cannot move, unless it gets hacked, and that takes a LOT of AP to pull off (and Chun could hold the hacker kit, making ship movement impossible). Since you implicitly cannot trust some of the crew due to the Mush crewmembers, if the captain is Mush (or a griefer) and on the ship, he can just leave the planet and kill everyone on the expedition, if any fuel is loaded in the combustion chamber. Also, anyone else can immediately take command if the captain dies on the expo, so its not a big deal if the captain dies, at least not as big a deal as the ship moving and killing the entire expedition, and losing the landing craft.

Q208: How does one get the title "Infected"?
On december 4, 2013
TradeFederation
ShuDogQ206 With everyone sleeping, I keep getting a notification that Janice's session with Chun is going well but she might need more time. I assume this is a psychological illness? Its spelled Zeno on Wikipedia. But unlike Achilles and the tortoise, there is a fixed number of treatments needed to cure all psych diseases, and it does not reset if you miss a cycle, so all mental diseases will eventually be cured, with enough cycles with a Shrink. And since its no AP cost to either shrink or patient, so its not a big deal to just keep at it until you are cured

TradeFederation
shadowlakeQ 213: Does picking the wrench skill give you any more efficiency with pilgred?
Also, does anyone have more than a 1% efficiency doing pilgred?

Yes, you get a bonus on the PILGRED with the Technician skill, even though its not listed on the skill pop-up. You also get a bonus on the PILGRED with the Physicist skill, AND a free repair point for the PILGRED each day. Only Raluca has the Physicist skill, but she can also 'double-dip' skills if she is a Silver or Gold player, and take both Technician and Physicist at level 3, which gives her a crazy HUGE double bonus on fixing the PILGRED, which also stacks with the free PILGRED repair point from Physicist. Super Raluca and her tech friend can easily tag-team the reactor to fully armed and operational status in two days or less, with a little teamwork, and MASSIVE glory was had by all...

If you are human with spores on you, you don't loose hp when taking a shower and you don't loose any spore if you don't use the Mush soap. (Actually, you can loose hp but only as an accident which doesn't happen very often).

If you are a Mush with spores on you, you won't loose any spore when taking a shower (even with Mush soap) but you will loose hp unless you have the lvl 6 skill to resist water.

[7936299]

Q221 How much does AP/MP/ does eating a ration do? What's the purpose of cooking them?
On december 5, 2013
[1306060]

A221: Eating an uncooked ration gives you 4 AP and costs 1 morale point (). Cooking a ration costs 1 AP (unless you have chef and use chef points), but the cooked ration gives 5 AP and no morale loss--so, in short, you cook rations in order to avoid the morale penalty when eating.

I will also note that, generally speaking, you should only eat if 1) you have the condition "starving" (or "hungry", I forget which; but it has an icon of a fork and spoon and you lose 1 HP every cycle with it) or 2) there's an emergency that you desperately need the extra AP for. Eating too much is a prime way to anger your fellow crewmates, as rations are limited.
On december 5, 2013

TradeFederation
Too_TonQ 250: I feel that Ian is a good character to main. Is that right? All I'm doing is staying in the plant room and caring for plants. Only thing is that I have full wasted ap

All characters can be good main characters, if you like their skills and command responsibilities, if any. Most characters have at least two good skills, that can be game changing, if you learn how to use them to their best effect. There are lots of other things besides plant maintenance that Ian is good at. If you are Silver, or pick Biologist (level 2), you could be a very good researcher in the lab (usually where the plants are kept), as that skill gives a large research bonus, and two researchers work MUCH faster than one. The extra hydropots skill can also be ship-saving in terms of food and Oxygen, and you will be using up all those extra AP with that many more plants to care for, and you should also consider going to a bed when offline, to regenerate AP faster.

A 260
Anyone can work on Pilgred, but only Physicists (Raluca) or Technicians (Terrence, Raluca, Kuan Ti, Eleesha, Hua) do more than 1 %. With one of these 3 skills they do 5-7 %, and with both skills Raluca does 7-13 %.

Everyone can also work on Neron projects (except when the Neron admin. has blocked access to projects, then only designers can work on them). For each project, two skills have a better efficiency.

On december 10, 2013
TradeFederation
Joe_Q272: Say a mush uses the transfer skill to swap places with me. Am I allowed to reveal that I seem to have changed characters or is that against the rules?

If you are currently human, you are on the human team, and should reveal whatever happens to you, Mush related, ASAP. If you become Mush, you only help the Mushies from that point on. If you go back to human, your allegiance changes back to human, so what you ARE, at the moment, is the deciding factor.
On december 10, 2013
[7922882]

Or, to make a long story short: yes you are allowed to reveal that a transfer was used on you.

AFAIK Mush can't use Transfer on fellow Mush, but even if it can it would probably be considered bad play and working against your team unless the other person agreed to it in the first place.

Q289: Can you travel to scanned planets that have been trashed? It seems like the coordinates would still be valid as long as the ship doesn't move, but I wanted to make sure. As a rule of thumb, should you trash planets with less that 8 properties?
On december 11, 2013
spacekadt
Bob_Q288: If you do a planet scan after leaving orbit and while the ship has started moving, is the planet destination still valid when you stop moving?

Yes, it's still valid. Once the ship starts moving (either into or out of orbit), the astroterminal acts like it's already at the destination.

The message about planets actually doesn't mean anything as far as what you're heading toward or the direction you're heading, but it does mean that you can scan for new planets.

Bob_Q289: Can you travel to scanned planets that have been trashed? It seems like the coordinates would still be valid as long as the ship doesn't move, but I wanted to make sure. As a rule of thumb, should you trash planets with less that 8 properties?

No. Once it's trashed, it's gone for good.
On december 11, 2013
TradeFederation
Bob_Q289, [part 2]: ...As a rule of thumb, should you trash planets with less that 8 properties?

Sounds like the old 'size doesn't matter' argument. If your size 2 planet has two oxygens, why would you want any more tiles ? If a planet has 8 tiles, that means you might have to chance injury 8 times to finish the expo, and you would have to scan the hell out of it to know if it has something nasty on it. The fact is, what your ship needs right now is way more important than the length of expo time, or collecting some fruit. You also have to consider the AP used up finding and scanning the planet. You REALLY don't want to scan a ton of planets before moving, unless they all have suck tiles, or nothing you want.

Private actions are never revealed by cameras.


GeneralThomasQ300: SPAARTA? SPARTAAAAA!!
Khm. I meant to ask that in a previous ship, someone mentioned that after a certain number of researches (and-or) projects, Neron doesn't allow any more to be done. Did he simply mean that we simply exhaust the stock of 3possibilites or there'sa limit?

For researches, the limit is the total number of existing researches. In theory, it is possible to do all of them.

For projects, once a project has appeared in the nexus, it can't appear a second time and you can't get it with a Neron upgrade. Once all projects have appeared in the nexus or been completed by the comms manager, no more projects are possible. (In theory again, the maximum number is 29 if you do almost all of them via Neron upgrade, but that's nearly impossible in normal circumstances).


300.5: Chun's Last hope for humanity + Optimist skill stacks? Meaning that person never has to worry about daily morale loss?
They stack, so Kuan Ti or Roland don't lose morale if they have that skill.

DD321123Apparently, we had a cycle changed on 2h56m.

I believe there are 3 cases when titles change. The 1st and 2nd case is when the current title holder dies or goes inactive, in which case the next person in line receives the title at the end of the cycle change. The 3rd case is when an inactive person who should have a title but doesn't because he went inactive goes back active, in which case the person immediately gets back the title without requiring a cycle change.

Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A331
There are 2 ways of healing wounds :
- Self-surgery using the surgery pod in the Medlab, for 4 AP (you must be lying on the bed for that)
- Surgery by a medic in the Medlab (the patient can be standing, and it only costs 2 AP). I read several times that medics can do the same with a medikit in other rooms (which would be logical, since the medikit is like a portable medlab) but I've never tried.

If the surgery fails, you get infection, which makes you lose 4 hp per cycle. But it's a physiological illness, so it can be cured easily by healing yourself or being healed.


A 322
Infecting the cat is not logged in the Mush channel.

[6826491]

A339: OCD prevents her from getting dirty while eating, working in the Lab, making repairs, and almost any human action on the ship. This serves to mostly counteract triggering her Germaphobe trait. However, becoming sick can cause her to vomit (which always makes you dirty,) and she can still get dirty from Mush actions. There's also a chance of returning dirty from an expo, particularly if the team went through any swamps. It basically acts as a permanent Apron for her.

A340: Yes. 10 shots normally, 16 max with a Neron upgrade. Charges regenerate at the rate of one per cycle. Always examine a patrol ship before you take off, so you don't use one that's out of charges or severely low on armor.

Q341 is it good idea to punch someone who have lost some health/full health before torture him/her?
On december 15, 2013
[6826491]

A341: Yes. You can see up to their last 8 actions through torture, and the torture itself does one damage each time you use it. You see as many actions as they have damage taken (up to 8, so don't go overboard.) You don't want to damage them too much though, in case they might be innocent, and will require healing afterward. Mush like to target people who have recently been tortured, since it's unlikely they will have been healed.

Q345: What kind of action is 'picking up' an object? And what kind of action is consuming an object? Could you consume objects and then have a reasonable way to frame someone else for it?
On december 15, 2013
[6826491]

A345: "Picking up" an object entails taking an object from a shelf (or using a container, and having the object appear in your inventory.) This can also include picking up your Talkie/Tracker or iTrakie, even though they are personal items, and the action is never logged.

"Consuming" involves eating a pill, ration, or fruit (or one of the consumable foods bought with Klix.) If there is a camera or other person in the room when you consume something, the action that you ate something is always revealed in the log. Eleesha might also see that action later, with her third skill. It's not very easy to frame the eating of something on someone else, even if there was a point you each were in the room alone. Basically, you'd have to know exactly when the other person was there, and that means being in the room yourself at some point - which also makes you a potential suspect.

Q357: Can things be hidden in rooms at the start of the round? Are items placed randomly? I'm not sure how to approach the inventory. If I just woke up (and I'm not Eleesha), should I be searching every room?
On december 16, 2013
[7950824]

A357: Items only get hidden by players, so use your judgment as to when, where, and if to search. If you know an object was in a room and there's no record of it being picked up or used up - it is almost certainly still in that room just hidden. Objects carried off by someone could be hidden in any room that character visits, or still carried by that player.

Items are sort of placed randomly, with a pretty high chance of being placed in storage rooms, but can end up anywhere. It's a great idea to make an item thread for your ship, post what is in each room (even the empty rooms, so people know those rooms have been checked already)
On december 16, 2013
[7918569]

Q358: Any quick tips for starting a new round as smoothly as possible? I just embarked on a new ship, which would be my third one, so I'd like to perform as well as possible. I've launched an AstroPad and opened a thread offering my help to newbies. (I'm the first person to wake up from cryo)
On december 16, 2013
[7950824]

A358: Did your first two ships go well? If so, do you remember what threads were up when you started? If not, the common threads to start seem to be Dirty, Project, Research, and Item. Other threads sometimes posted seem to be 'common newbie mistakes', maybe also including 'basics for avoiding getting turned into a Mush'. If your character doesn't have specialized skills, consider helping list inventory around the ship. Consider moving items found nearer or to where they belong, consider advancing research.

Consider not connecting to sol until everyone's aboard to get the morale bonus.

Some players recommend doing nothing until most/all area aboard, but that can backfire because not everyone's going to do that - and too, the ship can get hunters or have other emergencies that probably shouldn't just be ignored until everyone's started the game.

Q 359: Could the Observant skill detect someone dropping their Walkie-Talkie?

359
No. Dropping a Walkie-talkie is always personal.

The Observant skill only reveals furtive actions (the ones that are revealed by cameras, like spiking or demoralizing). It can also detect secret actions (actions revealed when there is someone else in the room or a camera, like eating or extracting a spore), but that were already visible in the logs.

On december 16, 2013
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?
sperbiQ362:
does a fire spreads normally every cycle to another room (with normally i mean without sprinklers)? And is spreading also affected by the general patchup?

It can spread to other rooms, either immediately (the same cycle as it appears) or the next cycle if it's not extinguished.

Fires are affected by the General Patching up but it doesn't prevent spreading. The sprinklers don't affect it either. They can extinguish a fire but it can spread to another room at the same time, though the sprinklers can also extinguish the second one, immediately or next cycle.

TradeFederation
MoxrexQ377 does a plant from a planet without oxygen produce oxygens ? how...

There are many reasons a planet might not have oxygen that are unrelated to plant life. The gravity could be too low to hold enough air near the surface to make an atmosphere as we know it. Did you know that Mars has both air and water, but because it has no MOON (and thus no stable axis of rotation), all of the water and air is trapped in frozen form, except for every so often when it wobbles to a position where the ice can melt and then it has an atmosphere for a brief period of geologic time. Now these things would also normally stop all known plant life from growing, but its just a game, and thus for gameplay balance and the sake of any other plant being a viable competitor with banana trees, they all have to be able to make air, or no one would ever grow any of them but the starter bananas.

On december 17, 2013
TradeFederation
MoxrexQ378 how much magebook that will be appear on the ship?

One random one at the start, then more based on your Comms officer activating Xyloph-17 Databases. You would normally get one Chef book, and other random books based on how much of the database you activate, and these bonus books appear on the bridge.
